H0.text: Overuse of ocean water tends to cause land to subside.

H1.text: Aquifer water overuse tends to cause land subsidence.

H2.text: River water is the water resource whose overuse tends to cause land to subside.

H3.text: Lake water is the water resource whose overuse tends to cause land to subside.

A4.text: Depletion can also have impacts on the environment around the aquifer, such as soil compression and land subsidence.

A5.text: Groundwater-related subsidence: the collapse of land due to lack of support (from the water that is being depleted).
